meanings.definition: The quality or state of being volatile.
meanings.sent1: The volatilities of the situation made it hard to predict the outcome.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the volatilities of different chemicals to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with the volatilities of teenage emotions.
meanings.sent4: The volatilities in the stock market kept investors on edge.
meanings.sent5: The volatilities of the weather made planning outdoor events challenging.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a substance to vaporize.
meanings.sent1: The volatilities of the liquid caused it to evaporate quickly.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the volatilities of different fuels is important for safety.
meanings.sent3: The chef used the volatilities of the spices to create a flavorful dish.
meanings.sent4: The volatilities of the perfume filled the room with a pleasant scent.
meanings.sent5: The volatilities of the essential oils made them perfect for aromatherapy.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of sudden or unpredictable changes.
meanings.sent1: The volatilities in the market led to uncertainty among investors.
meanings.sent2: The volatilities of the political landscape made it hard to anticipate the next move.
meanings.sent3: The volatilities of the game kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The volatilities of the relationship made it exciting yet unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The volatilities of the situation required quick decision-making.
